Title.evidence: new-generation Hydrogel Endovascular Aneurysm Treatment Trial (HEAT)

Trial_Design.evidence: HEAT is a randomized, controlled trial

Participants.evidence: subjects with ruptured or unruptured 3- to 14-mm intracranial aneurysms amenable to coiling

Intervention.evidence: compare recurrence between the second-generation HES and bare platinum coil (BPC)

Objective.evidence: To compare recurrence between the second-generation HES and bare platinum coil (BPC)

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary endpoint was aneurysm recurrence using the Raymond-Roy scale

Number_Randomised.evidence: A total of 600 patients were randomized (HES, n = 297 and BPC, n = 303)

Result_Outcome.evidence: Recurrence occurred in 11 (4.4%) subjects in the HES arm and 44 (15.4%) subjects in the BPC arm ( P = .002)

Harms.evidence: adverse events related to the procedure and/or device
